str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Probably of Hebrew origin; Lazarus, the name of two Israelites.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Of Chaldee origin; date-house; Beth-any, a place in Palestine.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A village, country town. From keimai; a hamlet.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman. Fem of adephos; a sister.
Martha, sister of Mary and Lazarus of Bethany. Probably of Chaldee origin; Martha, a Christian woman.
